page.title: 05St.Ruan
page.content: The name Ruan comes from St.Rumon.His name is associated with Ruan Minor and Ruan Major which are in the area and Ruan Lanihorne which is on the River Fal.He was an Irishman and in the sixth century set up the monastery bishopric Treguier in Brittany.Before this in the fifth century he left Ireland and came into Cornwall to begin his work in the rough area of the Lizard peninsula. Near Ruan Minor there is a little valley which is called St.Ruan and a cottage there named St.Rumon.It seems as though St.Rumon lived somewhere around here.St.Ruan is quite different from the rest of the area because it is peaceful and sheltered and has lots of trees.
